definition.name: NXcg_polyhedron_set

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: c
symbol.doc: The cardinality of the set, i.e. the number of polyhedra.

symbol.name: n_e_total
symbol.doc: The total number of edges for all polyhedra.

symbol.name: n_f_total
symbol.doc: The total number of faces for all polyhedra.

definition.doc:
Computational geometry description of a polyhedra in Euclidean space.
Polyhedra, also so-called cells (especially in the convex of tessellations), here described have to be all non-degenerated, closed, built of and thus built out of not-self-intersecting polygon meshes. Polyhedra may make contact, so that this base class can be used for a future description of tessellations.
For more complicated manifolds and especially for polyhedra with holes, users are advised to check if their particular needs are described by creating (eventually customized) instances of an NXcg_polygon_set, which can be extended for the description of piecewise-linear complexes.

field.name: center
field.doc: Position of the geometric center, which often is but not necessarily has to be the center_of_mass of the polyhedra.

field.name: surface_area
field.doc: Total surface area as the sum of all faces.

field.name: number_of_faces
field.doc: The number of faces for each polyhedron. Faces of adjoining polyhedra are counted for each polyhedron. This field can be used to interpret the array/field with the individual area values for each face.

field.name: face_area
field.doc: Area of each of the four triangular faces of each tetrahedron.

field.name: number_of_edges
field.doc: The number of edges for each polyhedron. Edges of adjoining polyhedra are counterd for each polyhedron. This field can be used to interpret the array/field with the individual length for each edge.

field.name: edge_length
field.doc: Length of each edge of each tetrahedron.

group.doc: Reference to or definition of a coordinate system with which the qualifiers and mesh data are interpretable.

field.name: identifier_offset
field.doc:
Integer which specifies the first index to be used for distinguishing polyhedra. Identifiers are defined either implicitly or explicitly. For implicit indexing the identifiers are defined on the interval [identifier_offset, identifier_offset+c-1]. For explicit indexing the identifier array has to be defined.
The identifier_offset field can for example be used to communicate if the identifiers are expected to start from 1 (referred to as Fortran-/Matlab-) or from 0 (referred to as C-, Python-style index notation) respectively.

field.name: identifier
field.doc: Integer used to distinguish polyhedra for explicit indexing.

group.name: polyhedra
group.doc: A simple approach to describe the entire set of polyhedra when the main intention is to store the shape of the polyhedra for visualization.

group.name: polyhedron
group.doc: Disentangled representations of the mesh of specific polyhedron.

group.name: polyhedron_half_edge
group.doc: Disentangled representation of the planar graph that each polyhedron represents. Such a description simplifies topological processing or analyses of mesh primitive operations and neighborhood queries.
